newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia June qtr capital expenditure jumps.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia June qtr capital expenditure jumps.

text.p: Australian private new capital expenditure rose 16.0 percent, seasonally-adjusted, in the June quarter to an estimated A$10.37 billion from A$8.95 billion (revised) in the March quarter, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said.
This compares with A$8.46 billion a year earlier. Figures are at average 1989/90 prices.

The third estimate for capex in 1996/97 is A$39.48 billion, a 9.7 percent increase over the second estimate last quarter of A$36.00 billion. The market had expected a rise in June quarter CAPEX of around 2.0 percent.
Actual private new capital expenditure (in billion A$, seasonally adjusted constant prices):
INDUSTRY June qtr 96 March qtr 96 June qtr 95
Total capital expenditure for the 1995/96 fiscal year ending June 30 was A$37.83 billion, on a current price unadjusted basis, against A$34.34 billion in 1994/95.
